thread.title: The third coming of Crist
thread.title_full: The third coming of Crist | Washington Examiner

author: Kelly Cohen
title: The third coming of Crist
text:
Former Florida Gov. Charlie Crist, once a Republican, has announced he will be running for Congress as a Democrat.
This will be Crist's third attempt to return to politics after losing a Senate bid in 2010 and Florida's gubernatorial race last year. He was elected governor as a Republican before becoming an independent and then a Democrat.
Crist, who made the announcement Tuesday in his hometown of St. Petersburg, will be running for Florida's open 13th District based on a new congressional map waiting to be approved by the Florida Supreme Court. The new map, which should be adopted soon, puts the district in the southeast corner of St. Petersburg, an area known to have a heavily Democratic population.
Great turnout for @CharlieCrist announcement... #FlaPol #sayfie pic.twitter.com/Qzzv3fkzhS — Amelia Chasse (@AmeliaChasse) October 20, 2015 
  Chelsea Clinton says her mom's Benghazi testimony will be 'remarkable' "I think every opportunity my mom has, she proves again and again why she should be our next president."
By Kelly Cohen • 10/20/15 12:00 PM "Public service is in my heart. I can't help it." - @CharlieCrist on @ABCActionNOW . pic.twitter.com/gfmGFcFH0h — Adam Z. Winer (@adamzwiner) October 20, 2015 
Should Crist win, he would replace U.S. Rep. David Jolly, a Republican who is running for Senate.
